question: How do I register?
answer: Go to the homepage and click on the 'Grow here' button.

question: Why is it called Codaru?
answer: Codaru is a combination of the words 'code' and 'haru', which means 'spring' in Japanese.

question: Are there any restrictions on joining?
answer: Only one! You just have to be over the age of thirteen years old to register for Codaru. (If you are under the age of eighteen, you must have parental consent to participate.)

question: Will captains be participating?
answer: No, captains will not be participating in Codaru. Captains will solely be leading, organizing, and mentoring their teams. They will be allowed to help minimally in the development of projects, BUT they will not be allowed to contribute to more than 10% of the codebase.

question: Is it a conflict of interest for the hosts to be judges as well?
answer: No, since the hosts will not be judging their own team's submissions, there is no conflict of interest.

question: Who will be judging the projects?
answer: The judges will be a small, privately selected panel of developers who are experts in their respective fields and the hosts. At their request, the judges' identities will remain anonymous.

question: Will there be prizes?
answer: Yes! They will be announced at the start of the competition. See the rulebook for more information.

question: Can I make my own team?
answer: No, you will be assigned to a team by the hosts shortly after joining the competition. (You will be notified via email.)

question: I don't understand a challenge description on the website. What should I do?
answer: Wait for the challenge to begin where further details will be provided and then ask for clarification in the Discord server or email the hosts.

question: How will projects be submitted?
answer: Projects can be submitted from GitHub or JSFiddle or CodePen or by any other platform where code can be shared via URL. However, if your site requires the application to be run locally, you must provide intuitive instructions on how to run the application via Docker Compose.

question: Are there any restrictions on projects?
answer: Yes, projects can be no more than 25MB in size and cannot contain any copyrighted material or malicious code. Projects cannot be plagiarized or copied from other sources.

question: Can I use AI?
answer: Yes, you can use AI to help with your projects in the brainstorming phase, but the AI cannot help with the development of the project or its source code. If AI code is detected by the hosts, you will be disqualified.

question: Can we use libraries or frameworks?
answer: Yes, you can use libraries or frameworks in your projects.

question: Can I miss a challenge?
answer: Yes! Although your team will miss you, Codaru prides itself on its flexibility. You may contribute to the competition as it fits your schedule. There will be no penalties for missed challenges.

question: Can I use old code or code from a previous challenge?
answer: Yes, you can use old code or code from a previous challenge, but you must denote the code via comments and your new code must be at least 50% of the submitted project.

question: Where do we submit our projects?
answer: The submission page is still in development, but it will be here at codaru.org. It will be released during the first challenge.

question: Can I collaborate with other people?
answer: Yes, you may only collaborate with members on your team. You must denote via comments who contributed which lines of code (i.e. "// xxx - {user}"). You must contribute roughly equally to the project.

question: How many people can I collaborate with?
answer: You can collaborate with as many people as you want on your team, BUT all collaborators must contribute roughly the same amount of work.

question: Can I submit more than one project?
answer: No, you can only indepdently submit or collaborate on ONE project.

question: If my project doesn't fit the theme, will points be deducted?
answer: Yes, if your project does not fit the theme, points will be deducted from your overall score.

question: How will the projects be judged?
answer: Projects will be judged according to the code cleanliness, how well the project fits the theme, the design of the project, the creativity of the project, and the efficiency/complexity of the code of the project.

question: What is the difference between teams?
answer: The only difference between teams is the person, called the Captain, leading them.

question: What programming languages are allowed?
answer: All non-esoteric languages are allowed for submission.

question: Where do I talk to my team and the hosts?
answer: You can communicate with your team and the hosts via the Discord server linked on the homepage.

question: Do I need to know how to code or be an expert to join?
answer: No! Anyone and everyone is welcome to join.
